Sample.Title: Human placenta, term not in labor, rep1

Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA was isolated from placental and FM tissues and cell lines using RNeasy Mini Kit (QIAGEN, Germantown, MD) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Using RNA extracted from placental and FM tissues (n=5 per tissue) and cells (n=3 per cell type), a cDNA library was prepared according to the Smart-3SEQ protocol

Sample.Data-Processing: Base calling was using Illumina's bcl2fastq2-v2.20 converter Adapter and polyA sequences were trimmed with cutadapt version 1.15 UMIs were removed from the reads and added to the read name with the extract_umi.py software provided by the Smart-3SEQ authors Reads were aligned to the human assembly GCA_000001405.15 using STAR version 2.7.5c using the parameters recommended by the software authors for the Encode consortium The dedup.py Smart-3SEQ software was used to mark and remove duplicated reads FeatureCounts software was used to count reads per gene using the Gencode annotation release 35 Assembly: GCA_000001405.15 Supplementary files format and content: Tab-separated values files output containing normalized raw counts from edgeR

Series.Title: Role of human fetal membranes in xenobiotic metabolism and nutrient transport
Series.Summary: This study characterized CYP450 and nutrient transport expression in human fetal membranes. RNA sequencing (RNA-Seq) of RNA derived from human placental and fetal membrane tissues and cells was done.
Series.Overall-Design: Comparative gene expression profiling analysis of RNA-seq data for human placental and fetal membrane tissues and cells from term not in labor women
Series.Type: Expression profiling by high throughput sequencing
